content:
Here's the short version across categories:

**Files and code** — read, write, edit files, run shell commands, manage background processes.

**Web** — search the web, fetch and read URLs, control a browser.

**Projects and tasks** — create and manage projects, tasks, ideas, inbox items, contacts, deals, sales pipeline.

**Intelligence** — morning briefings, weekly reports, financial summaries, AI Council validation, deep search across all your data.

**Content** — draft blog posts, proposals, emails, social copy.

**System** — canvas navigation, capability updates, strategic directive updates, profiling gaps.

**Memory** — long-term memory search and storage across sessions.

**Scheduling** — cron jobs, reminders, timed events.

**Messaging** — send messages across channels like Telegram, Signal, Discord.

**Coding agents** — spawn Claude Code, Codex, or OpenCode as background sub-agents pointed at any project directory.

**TTS** — convert text to speech.

**Vision** — analyze images.

And on the Nitara side specifically, I have the full suite — inbox, tasks, projects, ideas council, CRM, deals, financials, health logging, content calendar, network analysis, and pipeline orchestration.

Basically the full stack — strategy through execution.
